programme.title: Nikki Glaser: Someday You'll Die
programme.desc: Nikki Glaser dives into a wide range of topics including why she doesn't want kids, the harsh realities of aging, her sexual fantasies, and plans for her own death all in her hilarious, unapologetic, and brutally honest style.

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Knuckleheads Larry (Sean Hayes), Curly (Will Sasso) and Moe (Chris Diamantopoulos) become embroiled in a murder plot and stumble into starring roles in a TV reality show while trying to save their childhood home.

programme.title: Better Off Dead
programme.desc: After his girlfriend dumps him for a skier, a teen (John Cusack) meets an exchange student (Diane Franklin) from France.

programme.title: Drinking Buddies
programme.desc: Although they're both dating other people, two co-workers (Olivia Wilde, Jake Johnson) hang out together in bars and try to ignore their mutual attraction.

programme.title: Snatched
programme.desc: Dumped by her boyfriend, Emily persuades her mother, Linda, to accompany her on an exotic getaway to South America. The two polar opposites must quickly work through their differences to escape from a wildly outrageous and dangerous jungle adventure.

programme.title: War on Everyone
programme.desc: Two corrupt cops, who make money blackmailing criminals, come up against one who may be far more dangerous than both of them.

programme.title: The Suicide Squad
programme.desc: The government sends the most dangerous supervillains in the world to the remote, enemy-infused island of Corto Maltese. Armed with high-tech weapons, they trek through the dangerous jungle on a search-and-destroy mission with Col. Rick Flag.

programme.title: Silver Linings Playbook
programme.desc: An unexpected bond begins to form between a man trying to rebuild his life and a young woman promising to help him reunite with his estranged wife.

programme.title: Beau Is Afraid
programme.desc: A paranoid man embarks on a darkly funny and nightmarish odyssey to get home to his mother.

programme.title: Ellen DeGeneres: The Beginning
programme.desc: Comic Ellen DeGeneres performs. From the Beacon Theatre in New York.

programme.title: Gary Gulman: The Great Depresh
programme.desc: The actor/comic shares his observations on millennial attitudes, his love for basketball, and menacing TV news theme songs, as well as insights into his own mental health journey and battle with depression; from Roulette Intermedium in Brooklyn, N.Y.

programme.title: The LEGO Batman Movie
programme.desc: There are big changes brewing in Gotham, but if Batman (Will Arnett) wants to save the city from the Joker's hostile takeover, he may have to drop the lone vigilante thing, try to work with others and maybe, just maybe, learn to lighten up.

programme.title: Marc Maron: Panicked
programme.desc: Comedian and podcaster Marc Maron performs a standup act; he offers his nuanced perspective on our increasingly uncertain world.

programme.title: Lewis Black: Red, White & Screwed
programme.desc: The comic performs at the Warner Theatre in Washington.

programme.title: Rosie O'Donnell: A Heartfelt Stand Up
programme.desc: The comic performs at the Levity Live Comedy Club in West Nyack, N.Y., delivering hilarious anecdotes about her family and details about the heart attack that changed her life.

programme.title: Pee-wee Herman Show
programme.desc: The comedian (Paul Reubens) performs with the improvisational group the Groundlings at the Roxy in Los Angeles.

programme.title: DC League of Super-Pets
programme.desc: Krypto the Super-Dog must convince a ragtag group of animals to master their own newfound powers to help him save Superman and the rest of the Justice League.

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: A lethal CIA agent (Dwayne Johnson) and his former classmate (Kevin Hart) encounter shootouts, espionage and double-crosses while trying to save the U.S. spy satellite system.

programme.title: Mom and Dad Save the World
programme.desc: The dastardly emperor (Jon Lovitz) of another planet beams up a station wagon with a California couple (Teri Garr, Jeffrey Jones) inside.

programme.title: El Diablo
programme.desc: An Eastern-tenderfoot Texas teacher (Anthony Edwards) teams up with a gunfighter (Louis Gossett Jr.) to save a girl from an outlaw.

programme.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
programme.desc: Still haunted by Beetlejuice, Lydia's life gets turned upside down when her daughter discovers a portal to the afterlife. When someone says Beetlejuice's name three times, the mischievous demon returns to unleash his very own brand of mayhem.

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine 2
programme.desc: The magical hot tub sends Lou (Rob Corddry), Nick (Craig Robinson) and Jacob (Clark Duke) to the year 2025 to prevent an unknown assailant from shooting Lou.

programme.title: Chris Rock: Kill the Messenger
programme.desc: The comic performs at South Africa's Carnival City Casino, the Apollo Theatre in New York and the Carling Apollo Hammersmith in London.

programme.title: Martin Lawrence: You So Crazy

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Unapologetic
programme.desc: The comic performs at the Lincoln Theatre in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Yvonne Orji: Momma, I Made It!
programme.desc: Interspersed with footage shot in Nigeria, the comic reflects on being a Nigerian American, talking about her haggling addiction and the line between cursing people out and putting curses on them; from the Howard Theatre in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Barbershop 2: Back in Business
programme.desc: The owner (Ice Cube) of a barbershop faces pressure from a corporation that is opening establishments in his neighborhood.

programme.title: Get a Job
programme.desc: A young man (Miles Teller) and his girlfriend (Anna Kendrick) struggle to find desirable employment after graduating from college.

programme.title: Heaven Help Us
programme.desc: Students (Andrew McCarthy, Kevin Dillon) reject authority in 1965 Brooklyn at St. Basil's Catholic School for Boys.

programme.title: Enter the Warriors Gate
programme.desc: A mysterious chest opens a gateway through time that transports teenage gamer Jack to an ancient empire. Jack will need all of his gaming skills to battle a cruel barbarian king, protect a beautiful princess and find his way back home.

programme.title: The Descendants
programme.desc: A man (George Clooney) simultaneously struggles with the decision to pull the plug on his comatose wife while facing pressure from relatives to sell 25,000 acres of unspoiled Hawaiian land.

programme.title: Mad Money
programme.desc: Three women (Diane Keaton, Queen Latifah, Katie Holmes) conspire to steal a pile of cash that the Federal Reserve Bank has earmarked for destruction.

programme.title: Adult Best Friends
programme.desc: Katie takes her best friend on a nostalgic trip to their hometown to tell her she's getting married. Their journey soon takes some unexpected turns courtesy of a bizarre rental homeowner, a bachelor party, and a few potential love interests.

programme.title: Bill Maher: Victory Begins at Home
programme.desc: The comic/social commentator performs at the Hudson Theatre, New York.

programme.title: Dennis Miller: The Raw Feed

programme.title: Nikki Glaser: Good Clean Filth
programme.desc: Nikki Glaser takes on a range of topics in her brutally honest yet conversational style, including dishing about sex, outlining the do's and don'ts of dating, how to trick someone into marriage and oversharing about her not-so-private parts.

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Two criminals (Billy Bob Thornton, Tony Cox) disguise themselves as St. Nick and an elf to rob stores at Christmastime.

programme.title: Bad Santa 2
programme.desc: Fueled by cheap whiskey and greed, a foulmouthed criminal (Billy Bob Thornton), his mean mother (Kathy Bates) and their angry sidekick (Tony Cox) conspire to bilk a Chicago charity on Christmas Eve.

programme.title: Joker: Folie à Deux
programme.desc: Struggling with his dual identity, failed comedian Arthur Fleck stumbles upon true love while incarcerated at Arkham State Hospital. Awaiting trial for the murder of five people, Fleck soon discovers the music that's always been inside him.

programme.title: The Brutalist
programme.desc: Escaping postwar Europe, a visionary architect arrives in America to rebuild his life. On his own in a strange new country, a wealthy industrialist recognizes his talent -- but power and legacy comes at a heavy cost.
A time traveler risks his life to change the course of history and save the future of humanity.

programme.title: Look Into My Eyes
programme.desc: A group of New York City psychics conducts deeply intimate readings for their clients, revealing a kaleidoscope of loneliness, connection and healing.

programme.title: Get a Job
programme.desc: A young man (Miles Teller) and his girlfriend (Anna Kendrick) struggle to find desirable employment after graduating from college.

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: A descendant of the mysterious secret society known as the Assassins uses his newfound knowledge and physical skills to battle the power-hungry Templar Order.

programme.title: Red Dawn
programme.desc: After foreign troops seize control of an American town, a group of young people takes refuge in the surrounding woods and launches guerrilla attacks against the enemy.

programme.title: Cleaner
programme.desc: Radical activists take 300 hostages at an energy company's annual gala in a high-rise building. It's now up to a former soldier who works as a window cleaner to save the hostages trapped inside, including her younger brother.

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder and determined to save others from the same fate, Dr. Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. While at first it seems to be a radical success, a darkness inside of him is soon unleashed.

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Convinced that Superman (Henry Cavill) is now a threat to humanity, Batman (Ben Affleck) embarks on a personal vendetta to end his reign on Earth, while the conniving Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg) launches his own crusade against the Man of Steel.

programme.title: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire
programme.desc: Godzilla and the almighty Kong face a colossal threat hidden deep within the planet, challenging their very existence and the survival of the human race.

programme.title: Sing Sing
programme.desc: A man is imprisoned at Sing Sing for a crime he didn't commit. When joined by a wary outsider, he finds purpose in staging an original comedy with a theater group of other incarcerated men.

programme.title: On Becoming a Guinea Fowl
programme.desc: On an empty road in the middle of the night, Shula stumbles across the body of her uncle. As the funeral unfolds, the cousins unveil the buried secrets of their Zambian family in a vibrant reckoning with the lies we tell ourselves.

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: A dramatization of the disaster in April 2010, when the offshore drilling rig called the Deepwater Horizon exploded, resulting in the worst oil spill in American history.

programme.title: The Double
programme.desc: An awkward office drone (Jesse Eisenberg) becomes increasingly unhinged after a charismatic and confident look-alike takes a job at his workplace and seduces the woman (Mia Wasikowska) he desires.

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: Accused of murder, a man (Justin Timberlake) must figure out how to bring down a system where time is money, enabling the wealthy to live forever, while the poor must beg for each minute of life.

programme.title: Waitress: The Musical
programme.desc: Jenna Hunterson is a waitress and expert pie maker stuck in a small town and a loveless marriage. When a baking contest offers her a chance at escape, Jenna fights to reclaim part of herself.

programme.title: Babygirl
programme.desc: A high-powered CEO puts her career and family on the line when she begins a torrid affair with her much younger intern.

programme.title: Casino
programme.desc: A New York bookie (Robert De Niro) and his pal (Joe Pesci) turn a Las Vegas casino into an empire, then one's money-hungry wife (Sharon Stone) helps bring it down.

programme.title: Show Me a Hero
programme.desc: Nick Wasicsko becomes the youngest big-city mayor in America; the obligation to build public housing in the white neighborhoods of Yonkers looms over Nick's new administration.

programme.title: Show Me a Hero
programme.desc: The Yonkers mayor and city council are given an ultimatum by a federal judge; public housing residents trapped in the deteriorating projects of West Yonkers watch and wait as the residents of East Yonkers make their opposition clear.

programme.title: Show Me a Hero
programme.desc: Mayor Wasicsko achieves some consensus and pushes through a housing plan with a tough vote; housing officials begin planning for new townhomes while the political cost to Wasicsko becomes apparent.

programme.title: Show Me a Hero
programme.desc: A new mayor pledges to oppose the housing; Nick Wasicsko tries to reconcile himself to life out of power as construction on the townhomes begins.

programme.title: Show Me a Hero
programme.desc: Nick Wasicsko plans his political comeback; the residents for the new townhouses are screened and chosen.

programme.title: Show Me a Hero
programme.desc: A comprehensive orientation process awaits the incoming residents; Mary Dorman is recruited to serve the incoming residents; Nick Wasicsko begins the long road back to political viability; the residents take possession of their new townhomes.

programme.title: Alien: Covenant
programme.desc: Crew members (Katherine Waterston, Billy Crudup) of the colony ship Covenant encounter a hostile alien life-form after traveling to a dark and dangerous planet on the far side of the galaxy.

programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: A thief (Leonardo DiCaprio) who enters people's dreams and steals their secrets gets a shot at redemption when he is given the dangerous task of planting an idea in someone's subconscious.

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: Brian O'Conner, back working for the FBI in Los Angeles, teams up with Dominic Toretto to bring down a heroin importer by infiltrating his operation.

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: After leaving her all-female island for the first time, Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot) discovers her full powers and true destiny while fighting alongside men in a war to end all wars.

programme.title: Wonder Woman 1984
programme.desc: Wonder Woman musters all of her strength, wisdom and courage as she finds herself squaring off against Maxwell Lord and the Cheetah, a villainess who possesses superhuman strength and agility.

programme.title: The Prince
programme.desc: A retired assassin is drawn back into his former life and a confrontation with an old rival when his daughter is kidnapped.

programme.title: Lost River
programme.desc: A single mother is swept into a dark underworld while her son discovers an underwater town.

programme.title: Skiptrace
programme.desc: A detective from Hong Kong teams up with an American gambler to battle a Chinese criminal.

programme.title: Civil War
programme.desc: In a fractured near-future America balanced on the razor's edge, a group of journalists must race through battlefields to reach the White House before D.C. falls.

programme.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
programme.desc: When a man is found dead, a woman who lives by herself in the dangerous marshlands of North Carolina becomes the main suspect. As the case unfolds, the verdict as to what happened becomes increasingly unclear, threatening to reveal many secrets.

programme.title: Annabelle
programme.desc: Members of a satanic cult invade the home of a man (Ward Horton) and his pregnant wife (Annabelle Wallis) and turn a vintage doll into a conduit for ultimate evil.

programme.title: Annabelle: Creation
programme.desc: Years after the tragic death of their daughter, a former toy maker and his wife welcome a nun and six orphaned girls into their farmhouse. Terror soon strikes when one child finds a seemingly innocent doll that appears to have a life of its own.

programme.title: Annabelle Comes Home
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren keep a possessed doll locked up in an artifacts room in their house. When the doll awakens the room's evil spirits, it soon becomes a night of terror for the couple's young daughter and her friends.

programme.title: Heretic
programme.desc: A diabolical Mr. Reed ensnares two young missionaries in a terrifying game of cat and mouse when they knock on the wrong door and are forced to prove their faith.

programme.title: The Meg
programme.desc: A massive creature attacks a deep-sea submersible, leaving it disabled and trapping the crew at the bottom of the Pacific Ocean. With time running out, a rescue diver must now confront an unimaginable threat -- a 75-foot-long prehistoric shark.

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: Bowling buddies become involved with a multimillionaire and his family wanted by mobsters in 1990s Los Angeles.

programme.title: Duplicity
programme.desc: Spies (Julia Roberts, Clive Owen) for rival corporations carry on a clandestine love affair while trying to find the formula for a product that will earn a fortune for the company that patents it first.

programme.title: Get a Job
programme.desc: A young man (Miles Teller) and his girlfriend (Anna Kendrick) struggle to find desirable employment after graduating from college.

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Convinced that Superman (Henry Cavill) is now a threat to humanity, Batman (Ben Affleck) embarks on a personal vendetta to end his reign on Earth, while the conniving Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg) launches his own crusade against the Man of Steel.

programme.title: A Different Man
programme.desc: Aspiring actor Edward undergoes a radical medical procedure to drastically transform his appearance. But his new dream face turns into a nightmare as he becomes obsessed with reclaiming what he lost.

programme.title: Cleaner
programme.desc: Radical activists take 300 hostages at an energy company's annual gala in a high-rise building. It's now up to a former soldier who works as a window cleaner to save the hostages trapped inside, including her younger brother.

programme.title: Barbershop
programme.desc: The owner of a popular barbershop considers selling the place to a loan shark who wants to convert it into a strip club.

programme.title: Barbershop 2: Back in Business
programme.desc: The owner (Ice Cube) of a barbershop faces pressure from a corporation that is opening establishments in his neighborhood.

programme.title: MaXXXine
programme.desc: Aspiring movie star and hustler Maxine Minx finally gets her big break. But as a mysterious killer stalks the starlets of 1980s Hollywood, a trail of blood threatens to reveal her sinister past.

programme.title: Katrina Babies
programme.desc: An intimate look at the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina and its impact on the youth of New Orleans.

programme.title: The Nun II
programme.desc: An evil spreads in 1956 France as a priest is murdered and Sister Irene once again comes face-to-face with the demonic nun Valak.

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A human soldier is sent from 2029 to 1984 to stop a cyborg killing machine, which has been programmed to execute a young woman whose unborn son is the key to humanity's future salvation.

programme.title: Maggie
programme.desc: When a deadly zombie virus sweeps the nation, a father stops at nothing to save his infected daughter.

programme.title: Green Lantern
programme.desc: The Green Lanterns have little regard for humans, who have been unable to harness the powers of the ring each member wears. But Jordan, a test pilot, may be the corps' only hope when an enemy called Parallax threatens the universal balance of power.

programme.title: Rambo
programme.desc: John Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) calls upon his long-buried but lethal skills to rescue a missionary (Julie Benz) and her comrades from the Burmese army.

programme.title: Easter Sunday
programme.desc: A man returns home to celebrate Easter with his riotous, bickering, eating, drinking, laughing, loving family.

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: The Cimmerian warrior (Jason Momoa) slashes his way across Hyboria on a mission that begins as a personal vendetta but turns into an epic battle against a supernatural evil.

programme.title: For Colored Girls
programme.desc: A group of women (Kimberly Elise, Janet Jackson, Loretta Devine) comes together in search of commonality and understanding in the wake of personal crises, heartbreak and crimes.

programme.title: The Strangers: Chapter 1
programme.desc: After their car breaks down in an eerie small town, a young couple is forced to spend the night in a remote cabin. Panic ensues as they are terrorized by three masked strangers who strike with no mercy and seemingly no motive.

programme.title: SAS: Red Notice
programme.desc: A groom's wedding plans are disrupted when a small army of well-trained criminals, led by Laszlo Antonov, hijack the Eurostar deep beneath the English Channel.

programme.title: Bad Moms
programme.desc: Pushed beyond their limits, three overworked and stressed-out mothers (Mila Kunis, Kristen Bell, Kathryn Hahn) go wild after ditching their daily routines.

programme.title: Outlander: Blood of my Blood
